The Hidden Power of the Worm
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Monster Types: Beaclon/Worm: The Hidden Power of the Worm
By Nate Railsback on Monday, August 28, 2000 - 08:02 pm:

This occured to me as I was raising my Worm for the last Battle Strategies post, but I wanted to see if anyone else had thought of this...

We all know how a Worm can hatch into an different main-type, right? And that its techniques change appropriately, giving you the same number of moves in its new form as in the old? Well, a Worm has a total of 15 moves, and only 3 of them need Tech Chains to be acquired. You can probably see where I'm heading with this- there are several monsters in the game who are a pain to fill out their move lists (Pixie, Gali, Zuum, Golem, etc.). If you have a Worm metamorphose into one of those main-types, you can get several chained (or possibly even Type-specific) moves without the hassle of all the battles involved! Furthermore, if it turns into something like a Pixie or Tiger, whose stat-gains are almost the opposite of the Worm's, you have probably the best Combining fodder in the game!

Any thoughts?

By Lisa Shock on Monday, August 28, 2000 - 09:26 pm:

There doesn't seem to be any real link to the main. Slim Shady tried it, and saved and reset (I was completely caught off-guard by my worm's cocooning!) and got several different mains by just resetting. As I recall, he got Naga, Gali, and Pixie...but, please check his comments on the topic!
